result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Makeba Latasha Wright

records.addlTxt: for failure to appear at the 10/18/22 return date

10:57 AM Defendant Makeba Latasha Wright not in court.  Attorney Jonathan Ross in court for State of Wisconsin. Cases called 22 CF 213 and 22 TR 1406 State requested warrant in criminal matter and default in Traffic matter. Court authorized warrant. Defaulted the traffic matter. Fines to be paid in 60 days. 10:58 AM
for a pretrial conference 9/2/22 at 8:30 A.M. and return date 10/18/22 at 10:00 A.M.
standard felony conditions, not possess/consume controlled substances w/out valid prescription, not possess drug paraphernalia

11:34 AM Prosecuting attorney Jonathan Ross in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Makeba Latasha Wright in court telephonically. waives reading of complaint, right to atty recited, $500.00 signature bond, standard felony conditions, not possess/consume controlled substances w/out valid prescription, not possess drug paraphernalia, defendant to comply w/booking process w/in the next three weeks, signed bond to be returned w/in 10 days, waives time limits to prelim, 22 TR 1406, not guilty pleas entered, matter to track,
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Return date scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant called to advise that she had her baby last night and will be in hospital for 3 days, requested to appear for initial appearance via phone.  Defendant to fax a written request.
Initial appearance on June 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Initial appearance on May 4, 2022 at 10:45 am.
